intro: Bupleurum glumaceum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bupleurum glumaceum is often found in grassy areas and along the edges of woodlands.
